metadata.Title: CVE-2020-0009 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
In calc_vm_may_flags of ashmem.c, there is a possible arbitrary write toshared memory due to a permissions bypass. This could lead to localescalation of privilege by corrupting memory shared between processes, withno additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is not neededfor exploitation. Product: Android Versions: Android kernel Android ID:A-142938932

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-0009` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-178.208
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-178.208
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1070.77
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1061.65

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-178.208').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-99.100~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1070.77').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1106.117').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.70~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1082.92~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.65').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1038.42~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1132.141').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.144').
